author: Louise Sassoon
title: Is this card sexist or not? Clintons removes birthday card featuring bear in X-rated pose after Twitter complaint
text:
Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Clintons has said it will remove a birthday card from sale after a woman complained on Twitter. 
Customer Lucy Dunn tweeted an image of the card which features a bear with its legs in the air. 
The message reads: "After a few drinks, she was up for pretty much ANYTHING!" 
Ms Dunn described the card as "disgusting" and later "sexist". 
Alongside a picture she wrote: "Happy birthday to any woman who 'deigns' to have a drink on their birthday. Found this in my local card shop @ClintonsTweet #disgusting.” 
Siam Goorwich added: “Oh god, that is SO vile!!!” Clintons has come in for criticism before for its 'council estate' Christmas card (Photo: PA) 
The card was on sale at the retailer’s St Albans store and other shops in its portfolio of more than 400 store locations across the UK. 
However, it is not known if all stores the stocked it. 
Clintons quickly responded to the tweet saying: “Dear Lucy, We sincerely apologise for any offence caused. 
"We have received confirmation from our buying team, that all stores will remove this card from sale tomorrow." 
The retailer was forced to pull sales of a Santa Claus 'Council Estate' Christmas card after it caused outrage in 2014. 
The £2 card ran a list of “10 reasons why Santa Claus must live on a council estate” including; he only works once a year; he’s never actually been seen doing any work in his whole life; he drinks alcohol during working hours. 
It was being sold by Clintons who at first described it as “funny” on their website but customers did not see the humour and hundreds took to Twitter to voice their opinions. 
Clintons quickly withdrew the card and apologised “without reservation.” Like us on Facebook
